title: Inventory Hold Placed Event
description: Published when inventory is placed on hold for quality, credit, administrative, or regulatory reasons. Holds prevent affected inventory from being allocated to orders until the hold is released. This supports quality control workflows, credit risk management, and compliance requirements. The held quantity is removed from the available-to-promise calculation.

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit identifier - the unique product code within the inventory system

hold_id.description: Unique identifier for the hold, used for tracking and releasing the hold later. Generated by the system when the hold is placed.

hold_type.description: Category of inventory hold determining the business process and approval workflow required for release. QUALITY_HOLD for suspected defects, CREDIT_HOLD for payment issues, ADMINISTRATIVE_HOLD for internal processes, REGULATORY_HOLD for compliance requirements.

quantity_on_hold.description: Number of units placed on hold. This quantity is subtracted from available-to-promise but remains in quantity-on-hand.

reason.description: Human-readable explanation for placing the hold, used for audit trail and communication purposes
reason.example: Quality inspection pending for batch received from supplier ABC

lot_number.description: Optional lot/batch number if the hold applies to specific inventory lots. Used for traceability in regulated industries.
